plugins.name: IcoSun
plugins.description:
What is Icosun?

Icosun is an open sourced replacement for Icomoon. Its a tool that allows you to convert SVG icons into web fonts. It ensures icons are scalable, accessible, and efficient for web and app development


What does the plugin export?

  1. Source SVGs - A folder containing all raw SVGs used to generate the font files. Ideal for mobile tech stacks that don't support font files as an icon input.
  2. JSON Unicode Map - A key-value mapping between icon names and the unicode values, making it easy to reference icons in your code.
  3. TypeScript Unicode Map - A TypeScript constant that maps SVGs to their unicode representations, allowing direct usage in TypeScript projects.
  4. Combined SVG - A merged single SVG file that links path data to the unicode values, providing a visual reference for your font set.
  5. Font Files - IcoSun generates all major font file formats, ensuring compatibility across different platforms. It outputs TTF, EOT, OTF, WOFF and WOFF2.


What makes IcoSun different?

  1. Duplicate Prevention - IcoSun detects duplicate icons and warns you before export, reducing manual errors in large icon sets.
  2. Simulate Output - SVG-to-font conversion often faces path-winding issues, leading to incorrect subtractions. With IcoSun, you can preview the final output inside Figma before exporting, minimizing unexpected rendering issues.


IcoSun is fully open source, feel free to make changes to the logic as you like 😀
plugins.tagline: Generet font file for your icon library

plugins.name: Winding Rule Inspector
plugins.description:
Warning: If you don't know what Winding Rules are, you probably don't need this plugin.


If you want to know more about winding rules, follow this link: https://oreillymedia.github.io/Using_SVG/extras/ch06-fill-rule.html


This plugin allows designers to quickly inspect the winding rule of vector objects in Figma. It provides instant feedback about the selected vector's winding rule, helping you understand and manage the rendering behavior of complex vector shapes.


Key features:

- Automatically displays the winding rule of the selected vector object

- Updates in real-time as you select different vector objects

- Provides clear notifications for non-vector selections or when no object is selected

- Runs unobtrusively in the background, allowing you to continue your design work


How to use:

1. Run the plugin

2. Select any vector object in your Figma design

3. A notification will appear showing the winding rule of the selected vector

4. As you select different vector objects, the notification will update automatically


This tool is perfect for designers working with complex vector illustrations, icons, or any projects where precise control over vector rendering is crucial. Understanding the winding rule can help resolve unexpected rendering issues and ensure your vectors display correctly across different platforms and use cases.


Note: This plugin only works with vector objects. Selecting any other type of object will result in a notification indicating that the selected object is not a vector.

accepted.name: Thierry
accepted.description: I am Thierry – a designer, developer, and, typographer based New York. I’ve worked with companies large and small, building and maintaining design systems.

plugins.tagline: This plugin allows designers to quickly inspect the winding rule of vector objects in Figma.

plugins.name: Oz Words
plugins.description:
Introducing Oz Words, the powerful content design plugin for Figma that streamlines your workflow and simplifies your development process.


How to use


  1. Rename the layer's name of your text by starting with "#t." and then follow with words. For example, "#t.back" or "#t.page_a.title"
  2. Open Oz Words Plugin, go to the library of the language you want to edit
  3. Look for the word you want to edit in code, edit and click save
  4. After saving, your text will update automatically


Note

This is our Beta version to test our concept. Please follow us for more updates. We are working on a simpler and user-friendly version and hope it will come out soon. Cheers!
plugins.tagline: With Oz Words, you can create text as components that can be edited and updated with just one click.

plugins.name: Chameleon
plugins.description:
🦎 CHAMELEON


Chameleon is a Figma plugin that turns color token management into a breeze. Build smart palettes, structure tokens, and export directly into native Figma Variables.



🎨 KEY FEATURES


🎨 Smart palette generation — create harmonious color ramps from a single base color


🌒 Auto dark theme — instantly generate dark versions of your palettes


♿ A11Y mode — contrast-optimized palettes that meet WCAG accessibility standards


🧷 Figma Variables export — full support for collections, modes, and cross-collection aliases


📤 JSON import/export — compatible with Figma Variables and Token Studio


✏️ Flexible structure — rename shades, palettes, collections, and modes while preserving links



🌒 AUTO DARK THEME


Instantly generate perceptually balanced dark palettes based on your light theme.


How it works:

  1. Inverts brightness scale: lightest shade (50) becomes darkest, darkest (900) becomes lightest
  2. Base color remains at position 500
  3. Brightness follows a perceptual (non-linear) scale
  4. Saturation is increased for dark shades, reduced for light ones
  5. Additional correction ensures visual harmony



🎨 BASE MODE


Best for:

  1. Creating aesthetic palettes without strict contrast rules
  2. Branding and accent color systems
  3. Visually balanced UIs with emphasis on artistic control


Generation logic:

  1. Base color is placed at center (shade 500)
  2. Builds out lighter (50–400) and darker (600–900) shades
  3. Brightness and saturation adjust relative to the base



♿ A11Y MODE


Palettes generated with perceptual brightness, ensuring strong contrast between shades.


Best for:

  1. Interfaces requiring WCAG compliance
  2. Government, medical, educational and fintech products
  3. Inclusive design for wide audiences


Generation logic:

  1. Builds a scale of perceived brightness
  2. Base color is positioned where its brightness fits best
  3. Shades are calibrated for target contrast
  4. Contrast between neighbors ≥ 1.3:1



📌 HOW TO USE


  1. Create your base palettes in the "Global" tab (5 to 15 shades)
  2. Enable A11Y mode if needed
  3. Switch between light and dark themes to evaluate the result
  4. Export everything to Figma Variables or JSON
  5. Youtube



⚙️ UINDER YHE HOOD


  1. HSL-based ramp generation
  2. Edge brightness: Light — 95% → 20%, Dark — 15% → 85%
  3. Auto positioning of base color (especially in A11Y mode)
  4. Built-in WCAG contrast checker
  5. Visual base marker (★)
  6. Full support for Figma Variables & Token Studio structure



🚧 STATUS


This plugin is in beta. We welcome feedback and are actively improving it.
plugins.tagline: Color token generator with automatic shade scales and Figma Variables export

plugins.name: FrameSwapper | Frame to Component
plugins.description:
✨Overview

FrameSwapper is a powerful Figma plugin that helps you replace multiple frames with the same name with a selected component. Perfect for design system implementation and large-scale design updates.


✨ Key Features

  1. 🔍 Smart frame detection: Automatically finds all frames with the same name
  2. 🖼️ Visual preview: Shows thumbnails of both frames and components
  3. ⚡ Batch replacement: Replace multiple frames at once
  4. 🎨 Component integrity: Maintains original component dimensions and properties
  5. 🔎 Search functionality: Quickly find components by name
  6. 📱 Clean UI: Modern, intuitive interface


🛠️ How It Works

  1. Select any frame in your design
  2. Click "Find Matching Frames" to detect similar frames
  3. Choose which frames to replace (or use "Select All")
  4. Pick a component from the available list
  5. Click "Replace" to transform your frames


💡 Use Cases

  1. Implementing design system components across multiple frames
  2. Updating old designs with new component versions
  3. Standardizing repeated elements across your design
  4. Converting prototype frames into component instances


🆕 Version 1.0.0 Updates

  1. Initial release with core functionality
  2. Smart component replacement system
  3. Visual preview system
  4. Search and filter capabilities
  5. Batch selection and replacement
  6. Modern, user-friendly interface


💡Resources & Links

📝 [Feedback Form](https://forms.gle/goMQSobvFav6Unjy9)


❤️Plugin & UXUI Designer

Cupi Ng

plugins.name: Color Shades Generator
plugins.description:
A simple Figma plugin that helps you generate beautiful color palettes with customizable shades. Perfect for creating consistent color systems as it will generate Styles and/or Variables.


Features


Color Generation


Generate 11 shades (50, 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900, 950) from a single base color

Two generation methods:

-- HSL Adjustments: Fine-tune lightness and saturation for each shade

-- LAB Interpolation: Create perceptually uniform color scales


Color Control

- Input base color using a color picker or HSL values

- Customize color name for your palette

- Real-time preview of all generated shades

- Adjust individual shade properties (lightness and saturation)

- Adjust contrast between each shade


Figma Integration

- Generate Figma Color Styles

- Generate Figma Color Variables

- Visual preview of the palette

- Automatic positioning of generated palettes


Code snippets:

Copy-paste ready code snippets:

- CSS variables

- Tailwind CSS

- Hex values

- HSL values


How to Use


1. Name your color palette

2. Select your base color (500 shade) using the color picker or HSL inputs

3. Choose your preferred generation method (HSL Adjustments or LAB Interpolation)

4. Customize individual shade adjustments if using HSL method or use contrast slider

6. Choose whether to generate Figma Color Styles and Variables

7. Click "Generate Palette" to create your color system

plugins.name: Bulletproof Icons
plugins.description:
🎯 Bulletproof icons


A simple figma plugin to quickly create what I call "Bulletproof" icons for your icon libraries.


Tired of readjusting your icon component layers, so that they don't break in your design? Using different icon from different icon libraries? This plugin will solve the problem of creating consistent icon components.


What does it do?

This plugin will make layer structure for all of your icon like this:


Frame/

├── Union

│ ├──Vector

├── Original


So, when you change color of your icon, resize it or do any other modification, and then change the icon component to another one your modifications won't reset or break. They will be consistent no matter what you do.


How to use?

It's so simple! There's no UI, just select one or multiple frames (not vectors) and run the plugin.

accepted.description:

mail: alisamusa.ms@gmail.com

plugins.tagline: Create consistent, scalable icons that maintain their quality across different sizes and use cases.

plugins.name: Cloudinary Image Uploader
plugins.description:
Upload Images from Figma to Cloudinary

This tool allows you to upload images directly from Figma to Cloudinary, streamlining your workflow by eliminating the need to manually download and re-upload files.


How It Works

Cloudinary Account Setup

  1. Ensure you have an active Cloudinary account.
  2. Obtain your Cloud Name from the Cloudinary dashboard.
  3. Configure Unsigned Upload Preset:


Configure Unsigned Upload Preset:

  1. Go to your Cloudinary dashboard.
  2. Navigate to Settings > Upload.
  3. Create an unsigned upload preset and configure the desired settings (e.g., formats, transformations).
  4. Make sure to set the preset as unsigned to allow direct uploads without authentication.


Upload from Figma

  1. Use a Figma plugin or script that allows exporting images to Cloudinary.
  2. Enter your Cloud Name and unsigned preset name in the plugin/script settings.
  3. Select the images in Figma and click Upload.
plugins.tagline: Upload images directly from Figma to Cloudinary

plugins.name: Work/Space
plugins.description:
Work/Space is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the setup of your Figma page structure with just a button click. It also includes a built-in traffic light management feature for page organisation, as demonstrated in the GIF.


Having been a developer in my past life, I can empathise with their challenges. Uncertainty about what to expect, especially when they use Figma for the first time, can delay project delivery. The inspiration for this plugin came from numerous discussions with various development teams. I realised that:


1. Developers generally don't understand Atomic Design Systems.


2. The 'Ready for dev' feature in Figma, while beneficial, isn't the most efficient way to visually communicate readiness to developers.


3. Crucially, not all development teams have access to the infamous 'Dev Mode' (a questionable decision, Figma), particularly smaller agencies or teams with limited budgets.


The traffic light system is an effective project management tool. The page management feature in Work/Space subtly encourages conversations with developers to minimise communication gaps effectively.


To make the best use of the plugin, you can set your own page structure using the source code. Contact me for more details :)


For any issues, suggestions or feedback, please reach out to me on my email hi@sai.design.

accepted.name: Sai Maniganahalli
accepted.description: I'm a multi-disciplinary designer based in Australia :)

plugins.tagline: Minimise your project setup time using Work/Space

plugins.name: Chroma UI
plugins.description:
Chroma UI revolutionizes color selection by combining the power of perceptually uniform OKLCH color space with an intuitive interface. Create stunning, accessible palettes that elevate your designs and streamline your workflow.


Create with Confidence

Make color decisions faster with intelligent tools that understand both aesthetics and accessibility. Every palette you generate comes with semantic color naming and WCAG-compliant text color recommendations, helping you build cohesive design systems that scale beautifully.


Professional-Grade Control

  1. Precisely adjust colors using the perceptually uniform OKLCH space, with familiar HEX, RGB, and HSL options
  2. Create smooth, mathematically accurate gradients that maintain consistent luminance
  3. Generate context-aware color names that adapt to your design system
  4. Ensure accessibility with automatic contrast checking and text color suggestions
  5. Export palettes directly to your design tools and documentation
  6. Spark inspiration with curated random palettes based on color theory principles


Essential For

🎨 Design Systems – Build scalable, consistent color foundations

🎯 Brand Identity – Craft memorable, on-brand color palettes

📦 UI Components – Ensure color harmony across your interfaces

📱 Digital Products – Create accessible, high-impact user experiences

💡 Creative Exploration – Experiment with unique, dynamic color schemes


Experience the next evolution in color tools. Chroma UI combines mathematical precision with designer-friendly workflows to help you create better color systems in less time.


Crafted for professional designers and teams who need scientific accuracy without sacrificing creative flexibility. Upgrade your color workflow today with Chroma UI.

plugins.name: Athlon TOC
plugins.description:
Navigate Your Figma Projects Like Never Before


A tool to streamline your design workflow. This powerful plugin automatically generates a detailed table of contents for your Figma files, making navigation through complex projects a breeze.


Features and Benefits:


Automatic Detection: The tool scans your Figma file and automatically identifies all sections and frames, organizing them into a clear, concise table of contents.


Clickable Links: Each entry in the table of contents is a clickable link, allowing you to jump directly to the relevant section or frame. No more scrolling through endless layers to find what you need!


Dynamic Updates: As your project evolves, rerunning the tool dynamically updates the table of contents to reflect changes, ensuring that you always have an up-to-date overview.


Vertical Auto-Layout: The table of contents is presented in a neatly organized vertical auto-layout frame, providing a clear and structured overview of your document.


Customizable Layout: While the tool takes care of the heavy lifting, you retain full control over the layout and presentation of your table of contents, ensuring it complements your design process.


Easy to Use:

Simply install the plugin, run it within your Figma file, and watch as it transforms your workflow, saving you time and effort.
plugins.tagline: Navigate with Ease: Instant Table of Contents for Your Figma Files

plugins.name: Fancy Text Generator
plugins.description:
✨ What It Does

The Fancy Text Generator instantly transforms your plain text into beautiful, stylized typography using Unicode characters.


Get multiple licenses ->


Perfect For

  1. Social Media Designers - Create eye-catching posts and stories
  2. UI/UX Designers - Add unique typography to interfaces
  3. Brand Designers - Develop distinctive text treatments
  4. Content Creators - Make text that stands out
  5. Anyone who wants to make their text more interesting!


⚡ Key Features

  1. 75+ Text Transformations
  2. Classic Styles: Old English, Medieval, Cursive, Bold, Italic
  3. Unicode Magic: Circles, Squares, Bubbles, Strikethrough
  4. Creative Effects: Upside-down, Mirror, Creepy/Glitch text
  5. Fun Styles: Cute text with emojis, Vaporwave aesthetic
  6. Mathematical: Subscript, Superscript, Double-struc
  7. And many more!


Seamless Figma Integration

  1. Real-time Preview - See transformations as you type
  2. One-Click Insert - Add text directly to your canvas
  3. Smart Font Detection - Automatically finds the best font for each style
  4. Perfect Positioning - Text appears centered in your viewport


Instant Results

  1. Type once, get 75+ variations instantly
  2. No font files to download or install
  3. Works with any text in any language
  4. Fast performance


How It Works

  1. Type Your Text - Enter any text in the input field
  2. Browse Styles - Instantly see 75+ fancy variations
  3. Insert to Figma - Click any style to add it to your canvas
  4. Copy text - Click to copy the generated text
  5. Customize - Adjust size, color, and positioning as needed in Figma


💡 Use Cases

  1. Social Media: 𝒴𝑜𝓊𝓇 𝒷𝓇𝒶𝓃𝒹 𝒽𝑒𝓇𝑒 for Instagram bios and posts
  2. Gaming: 🅶🅰🅼🅴🆁 🆃🅰🅶 for Twitch overlays and gaming content

  3. Real-time text transformation engine

plugins.name: Stroke Manager
plugins.description:
Stroke Manager is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you efficiently manage stroke properties across multiple elements simultaneously. Perfect for designers who work with illustrations, icons, wireframes, or any vector content.


Key Features


  1. Batch Update Strokes: Modify stroke width, alignment, and end caps across multiple elements at once
  2. Smart Color Management: Map colors individually or override all strokes with a single color
  3. End Point Styling: Quickly apply different cap styles (round, square, arrow)
  4. Nested Elements: Apply changes to parent elements and all their children with a single click
  5. Color Detection: Intelligently groups similar colors to simplify your workflow


Why You'll Love It

Save valuable time by updating dozens or hundreds of stroke properties in seconds instead of tediously modifying each element individually. Stroke Manager is particularly useful when adapting illustrations for different sizes or contexts, ensuring consistent stroke weights and styles throughout your design.

Perfect for design system maintenance, icon libraries, and illustration collections, Stroke Manager helps you maintain visual consistency while dramatically speeding up your workflow.
plugins.tagline: Batch Update Strokes

plugins.name: deeepSpace
plugins.description:
deeepSpace Plugin (Beta) – Bring Your Design System to Life 🚀


Transform your design systems into scalable, production-ready code with the deeepSpace Figma Plugin (Beta). Designed for creators and builders who prioritize scalability, efficiency, and speed, deeepSpace makes it effortless to bridge the gap between design and development without unnecessary complexity.


What Makes deeepSpace Awesome?


🚀 Unmatched Speed: Push your design system to deeepSpace in just seconds. It’s so fast, you’ll wonder how you worked without it!


💡 Design-System-First: Forget bulky page-level exports. We focus exclusively on your design system to ensure your components are scalable, reusable, and developer-ready.


🛠️ Developer-Centric Code: No messy, bloated output – just clean, structured code that your dev team will love. Minimal edits required!


📦 Complete Workflow Integration: From the Figma Plugin to the deeepCLI and web interface, our tools work together seamlessly to keep your projects and design systems organized.


Beta Features:


This is our beta version, and we’re constantly improving! Try it now and help us shape the future of design-to-code workflows. Your feedback will directly influence the next steps of deeepSpace’s evolution.


How It Works:


1.Design your system in Figma.

2.Use the suuuuper fast deeepSpace Plugin (Beta) to push it to your workspace.

3.Generate and pull production-ready code with the deeepCLI.


Effortlessly manage your design system and projects through the deeepSpace web interface. Collaborate, track progress, and keep everything organized in one place.


Join our beta and help build scalable products faster than ever with deeepSpace! 🎉
plugins.tagline: “deeepSpace Figma Plugin – Supercharge Your Design System to Code Workflow, Faster Than Ever! 🚀”
